  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location four plastic jerricans were found with signs of a release. The spill agent observed that the screw cap was loose on all four jerricans. All the jerricans were placed into steel salvage packages and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024100135
item.description:
Report E-2024100135

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-05
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1110ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release located at terminal NMP. It was reported that approximately 2 quarts of Carboline THINNER 215 released from (1) 1-gallon metal pail due to a nail going through the bottom (shipper responsible). The release was contained to the trailer. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. 216996-1 5-gallon DM contains (1) metal pail, product, spent oil dri, and PPE. The waste was placed at terminal for personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024091731
item.description:
Report X-2024091731

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-01T09:15:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-25
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was presented to the MEMH spill office as on odor. While investigating the shipment the spill agent observed that one of the two metal cans inside was leaking from the lid. The cans had positive closure rings and packing paper for dunnage. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.description:
Report X-2024091833

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-29T09:14:16+00:00

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Undeclared spill. Two 1-gallon metal cans of PPG 7-Line LV Alkyd paint leaked due to lids opening. Approx 1 gallon spilled. Labels damaged on remaining cans. Lids shipped with plastic rings, but no clips. Outer carton not significantly damaged other than from internal leakage. Flashpoint 84.2 F. No hazmat markings.

  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=407039768880 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Unloading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1263 CLASS=30 QTY UOM=Liquid - Pint PSN TEXT=Paint PKG GRP=II SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=1 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Quart MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=A - Metal (any type) NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=4 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=2 - Can TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=1 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Quart )Undeclared spill. Carton containing two 1-qt metal cans of KD3001 sealer, one 1-qt KBC03 basecoat, and two 8 oz metal cans of KDA3000 hardener. Cans shipped in larger box w/insufficient dunnage. All cans dented. Both KD3001 cans leaked, approximately .5 pint spilled. Crushed carton. No hazmat markings. KD3001 and KBC03 flashpoints below 100 F, KDA3000 flashpoint 100.4 F.
